stanza.line: Canst thou O cruel say I love thee (a)not(/a)
When I against my self with thee (b)partake(/b)
Do I not think on thee when I (a)forgot(/a)
Am of my self all-tyrant for thy (b)sake(/b)
Who hateth thee that I do call my (c)friend(/c)
On whom frown'st thou that I do fawn (d)upon(/d)
Nay if thou lour'st on me do I not (c)spend(/c)
Revenge upon my self with present (d)moan(/d)
What merit do I in my self (e)respect(/e)
That is so proud thy service to (f)despise(/f)
When all my best doth worship thy (e)defect(/e)
Commanded by the motion of thine (f)eyes(/f)
But love hate on for now I know thy (g)mind(/g)
Those that can see thou lov'st and I am (g)blind(/g)
